alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 22 at 10:07AM CDT until March 25 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi... Tombigbee River near Amory For the Tombigbee River...including Bigbee and Amory...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River near Amory. * WHEN...From this evening to early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Widespread lowland and farm land flooding is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 12.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 24.1 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
